title: Ticket #5884: Prefer depth-first matching of pslots in negotiator
description:
When the negotiator matches a job to a pslot, by default, it hands out the whole pslot to the schedd, which the schedd can us to match further jobs. Although, the negotiator will charge the user for the whole weight of the pslot, and stop handing out pslots when the submitterLimit is hit, this assumes that all jobs match all slots. If this isn't the case, and jobs are selective, it is possible that the negotiator will hand out too many pslots, and cause unneeded fragmentation of the pslots.

CMS is seeing pslot fragmentation, so we will add a knob that will assume that if one job in an autocluster matches part of a pslot, the negotiator will ignore as many subsequent jobs in that autocluster which should fit it that pslot. This knob is called NEGOTIATOR_DEPTH_FIRST.
